An architecture that can be consensual whilst catalytic, mundane yet dramatic. We are committed to the craft of sustainable construction and the research of new technologies in pursuit of making buildings that fulfil not only our clients’ expectations of space, light and air, but also economic and efficient procurement and environmental responsibility. description: Our thorough nuts and bolts approach to architecture and design is a fundamental part of our practice philosophy. Address 59 York Road, Northampton, NN1 5QL Contact Adrian Ringrose

name: Stitch Studio Limited
address: 44 Charlotte Street, London, W1T 2NR
description: From streets to square feet, thriving neighbourhoods are sewn together, not thrown together. Our design process encompasses the relationships people have with buildings, spaces and each other. Taking a broader approach not only leads to strong physical connections, through massing and form, it also fosters strong emotional connections with the community. Joining everything up does, however, necessitate a different architectural mindset. Local neighbourhoods, by their very nature, involve many stakeholders, and accommodating every point of view can lead to numerous compromises. The best schemes, we believe, are those that reach consensus by shaping an overarching vision, which the whole community will support. Rather than begin with design concepts, we start with the best overall experience and then work back to the architecture needed to deliver it. For us, design should create an experience that delights and improves the lives of everyone. We believe the only way to do this is with a joined up approach. By walking the streets, by living social value, by serving the greater good our mission is to help create the thriving neighbourhoods of the future. Neighbourhoods that everyone can be proud of. Address 44 Charlotte Street, London, W1T 2NR Contact Sally Lewis Twitter @stitch_arch Instagram stitch_architects

name: Stoas Architects
description: In ancient Greek architecture stoas were designed to create safe, enveloping, protective atmospheres which combined useful inside and outside space. Stoicism — named for the stoa — is the philosophy of personal ethics and an informed, mindful system of logic, which perfectly explains our belief that buildings are more than just bricks and mortar. Buildings should be practical, protective, and inspirational. Hence our name — STOAS — reflecting our ethos of logic, efficiency and leading-edge design. Addresses Coleshill Manor Office Campus, The Lodge, South Drive, Birmingham, B46 1DL 1 Dunston Place, Dunston Road, Chesterfield, S41 8NL Contact Chris Bravington

name: Stockwool Llp
address: 6 Orsman Road, London, N1 5QJ
description: Stockwool creates places that enrich all of our lives. A leading practice for urban regeneration, we design buildings and spaces that are well-considered and imaginative. Our work is commercially astute, context-led and prioritises townscape quality. Our team of architects and urbanists feel passionately that architecture can and does make a positive difference to the world we live in. Based in London, we have built up a portfolio of acclaimed projects across the capital and the South East. As experts in urban regeneration, much of our work is housing led and we understand all of the elements that make somewhere a great and sustainable place to live, with notable experience in the design of health and leisure facilities, shops, schools and offices. Every one of our projects is the result of an open, thorough and collaborative design process which draws on our 30 years of experience while embracing modern thinking. We pursue design excellence from the detail of a door handle to the scale of an entire neighbourhood. We don’t have a house style. Our design ethos unlocks what is unique and special about a project through listening to the client, understanding their vision and rigorously analysing the context to maximise the creative opportunity. Address 6 Orsman Road, London, N1 5QJ Contact Gavin Redfern Twitter @stockwool Instagram stockwool

name: Stolon Studio Ltd
address: Unit A, Willow House, Dragonfly Place, London, SE4 2FJ
description: We work closely with our clients to understand what matters most to them, drawing out the subtleties of a brief and the real human needs that sit at a project’s heart. Our work is unashamedly optimistic, with projects that speak to the hidden aspirations and ambitions of our clients, and which support the way that people want to live and work, both now and in the future. We create simple yet transformational projects, whatever the budget, with designs that are functional, adaptable and achievable. We never lose sight of the role design has to play in addressing the bigger societal challenges we face, such as climate change, flood-risk, public health or an ageing population. We look to maximise social, environmental and economic value in all our work, with built projects that demonstrate our commitment to problem-solving, and which are genuinely innovative in terms of concepts, materials and technology. Address Unit A, Willow House, Dragonfly Place, London, SE4 2FJ Contact Jessica Barker Twitter @stolonstudio Instagram stolonstudio

description: Good architecture can transform lives and rejuvenate places. We focus on the needs of individuals and use design to improve their emotional wellbeing and surroundings. This simple philosophy informs all our work. Our responsibility is to interpret the aspirations of those who commission us – and those who inhabit the places we design – in a way that responds directly to need. Each project is unique and our approach is always to seek bespoke solutions. These solutions are the product of analysis of physical context and close engagement with our clients. We consider time spent developing a real understanding of requirements at the initial stages of a project as invaluable. It forms the basis for creating clear, simple and appropriate design solutions. name: Studio Bark
address: 25 Vyner Street, London, E2 9DG
description: Studio Bark is a young studio with a great passion for designing outstanding architecture and challenging the status quo. We have a successful track record securing planning permission for ambitious designs on challenging sites across the UK. Our portfolio of built work encompasses residential and community projects with a specialism in bespoke homes and have extensive experience delivering projects through Paragraph 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF). In addition to architectural design services outlined in the Bark Client Journey, we offer site finding and site evaluation services drawing upon our detailed knowledge of planning policy. Depending on the project, specialist construction and fabrication services can be provided through our contracting arm, Studio Bark Projects. We have developed the widely-published U-Build flat pack construction system for aspiring self build clients. We challenge outdated ideas about architecture, construction, education, and modern business management. Address 25 Vyner Street, London, E2 9DG Contact Wilf Meynell Twitter @StudioBark Instagram studiobark

address: 37@ Pall Mall Deposit, Barlby Road, W10 6BL
description: STUDIO BEDNARSKI is an award winning, dynamic design practice, established in October 2001. We offer imagination and inventiveness combined with pragmatism - creative design solutions in architecture, urbanism and interiors. We pursue visible and unseen beauty, and ways of achieving more with less. Our designs, in Britain and overseas, evolve from search for a balance between functional, cultural, technological, climatic and economic conditions in which a project is set. Our approach to sustainability does not stop at the selection of ‘green’ materials and technologies but recognises that ‘building’ is by its nature an ‘unnatural’ pursuit. We aim for our structures to be clever, flexible and mutable enough to outlive their transient uses. Address 37@ Pall Mall Deposit, Barlby Road, W10 6BL

name: Studio Bua
description: Studio Bua’s London-based architecture and interior design practice is grounded in a human-centred approach to creating spaces that hold a quiet gravitas. Founded by Mark Smyth and Sigrún Sumarliðadóttir in 2017, Bua (meaning ‘to inhabit’ in Icelandic) believes in making sensitive observations of existing environments and how our clients wish to thrive within them. This leads to collaborative projects that form a harmony with their surroundings through impeccable craftsmanship and sustainable materiality. Working on cultural, commercial and private buildings, as well as interior, landscape and exhibition design, we respect the cultural heritage of each context while introducing a sophisticated language that delights in its unexpected details. This enduring dialogue between the grand and the intimate, the raw and the refined, the ancient and the modern, results in thoughtfully told stories that confirm our belief that how we live – and where we inhabit ­– is nurtured by robust, honest design. Address Studio Bua Unit B3, Sutherland House, London, E17 6BU, E17 6BU Contact Mark Smyth Instagram studio_bua

We’re interested in strategic frameworks, how things fit together, and the in-between spaces that provide the glue. We know that we’re only part of the story – places will keep evolving long after we’ve gone and they’ll always be part of something greater. address: The Hermitage, 15a Shenfield Road, Brentwood , CM15 8AG

We are passionate about design from the scale of neighbourhood to a child’s toy, approaching all our projects with sensitivity, care and playfulness. We are an energetic team, based at our studio in Ilford, Redbridge, with buildings in the UK and Latin America. Recently, Studio Gil was selected by the Architects Journal AJ100 (2020) as one of 25 ‘Disruptor’ practices, demonstrating an alternative approach to British practice through our socially engaged work. Address Ilford Space, Studio 3, 1 Oakfield Road, Ilford, IG1 1EF Contact Pedro Gil Twitter @StudioGil Instagram studiogil

The design process is an enormous recipe of technical and emotional ingredients, that are so specific to the context of each project; so specific and cumulatively have the potential to facilitate and inspire transformation on so many levels. That is why I lead this studio and that is why I believe in design- as a verb and not a noun. It has the potential to create thriving environments that can create the conditions for us all to flourish. Address 63 Britton Street, London, EC1M 5UY Contact Jenny Jones

name: Studio Verve Architects
address: Unit 1C Haggerston Studios, 284 - 288 Kingsland Road, London, E8 4DN
description: Studio Verve is an award-winning, design-led RIBA Chartered Architecture Practice based in Haggerston, East London. The practice is led by women directors Vivian and Yuk Yee who are also both partners in life and work and who have complementary personalities and fortes that enable the smooth running of a busy architecture practice. We undertake sustainable, biophilic architecture and interior design of one-off homes, major extensions, housing-led mixed use schemes and masterplan. These areas of work span across historic Listed Buildings, sensitive green belt, conservation areas and even Unesco World Heritage sites. We provide a full service from feasibility, planning, architectural design and construction supervision to also include interior and graphic design. We use Building Information Modelling (BIM) for complex projects to provide for iterative early stage designs, developed building components, documentation, schedules and wider design team coordination. Our designs — often bold and contemporary — are underpinned by an interplay of imagination and technical rigour, mostly accompanied with an element of surprise in their concept and delivery. The spaces we create are well-used and loved. We value lateral thinking and non-conformity. We aspire to challenge and exceed the client’s brief and provide innovative and sustainable solutions that are both delightful and spatially inspiring. Each year we pledge 5-10% of our time to good causes through meaningful Pro-Bono work to serve the less fortunate in society. Address Unit 1C Haggerston Studios, 284 - 288 Kingsland Road, London, E8 4DN Contact Vivian Chan Twitter @StudioVerveArch Instagram studiovervearchitects

address: 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE

We value idiosyncrasies, from the characteristics that make somewhere unique, to the particular skills of a master craftsperson. We aim to harness the strengths of a project and its team to create something distinctive and of exceptional quality. Address 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE Contact Je Ahn Twitter @studioweave Instagram studioweave

Changing demographics, new legislation on planning, space standards and sustainability along with the escalating cost of housing require a fundamental re-assessment of the domestic model. Our aim is to improve the quality of housing by designing homes that can adapt to the demands of a modern changing society. We believe value can be added by eliminating the ‘poor value’ elements of building costs not by a reduction in space standards. Address 54-56 Tanner Street, London, SE1 3PH Contact Freddy McBride

Studioort embraces the opportunities and challenges of our rapidly changing world and aims to contribute with creative thinking, experience and knowledge of the built environment. Address Unit Z, 23 Alphabet Mews, London, SW9 0FN Contact Artison Wangpraseurt Instagram studioort

We eschew a house style, instead spending the early stages of a project analysing and interrogating the brief and context. With these, we develop designs that are highly contextually sensitive, with careful consideration of materiality, construction technique, use and function. Address 20a Iliffe Yard, London, SE17 3QA Contact Tom Surman Instagram surmanweston

name: Sutherland Hussey Harris Architects
address: 40 Constitution Street, Edinburgh, EH6 6RS
description: Every project is unique and thus requires a carefully crafted response. We recognise the need for intensive client involvement in the process, from the early sketch to the final built detail. In the end this results in the finished project being strongly tied to the initial design concept. Throughout the process the development of details, materiality, construction and the making of space are fundamental to the realisation of the project. This results in identifiable, coherent buildings with a simple integrity. Address 40 Constitution Street, Edinburgh, EH6 6RS Contact Charlie Hussey

name: Sutters Partnership
address: 15 Granard Avenue, London, SW15 6HH
description: Architecture will always be our core service but we recognise the importance of our in-house planning service. We integrate the two at an early stage to avoid the pitfalls that often arise when initial designs are developed from a generic checklist of planning policies. By adopting this more nuanced approach, we are able to guide our client’s expectations from the outset. Our success in gaining consent, even in sensitive conservation areas and when dealing with heritage assets, is testament to the way in which we work. We adopt a light touch, low energy approach to architecture for both new build and retrofit. Many of our projects employ Passivhaus principles and we aim to make the most of a site’s intrinsic natural resources. We believe that the spaces between buildings should be well designed and integrate our schemes with their wider setting. We therefore offer landscape design services often in close collaboration with our arboricultural partners. Address 15 Granard Avenue, London, SW15 6HH Contact Trevor Sutters Twitter @SPArchitects Instagram sutterspartnership

name: Syte Architects
address: 10 Golden Square, London, W1F 9JA
description: The intention is that projects are not the product of a house style, but emerge from a process of research and investigation. Where careful consideration of materials, light and the site, alongside the client’s brief and budget, create an architecture that is beautiful but allows the opportunity for inhabitation and the patterns everyday usage to form part of the architectural expression. The studio has a friendly and relaxed atmosphere and we firmly believe that good design should be a enjoyable process. The result of this is achieved by collaboration, where all members of the studio can openly contribute and ask each other, and our clients, “what if?” Through this approach we aim to identify and achieve the full potential of every project we work on. A strong emphasis is placed on an understanding of building materials and the construction process. We are committed to producing an architecture that is elegantly detailed and where qualities of materials, space and light can become evident. Address 10 Golden Square, London, W1F 9JA Contact Oliver barsoum Twitter @SyteArchitects Instagram sytearchitects

Social, cultural, economical and political aspects of the background context also play important roles regardless of the scale of the project. t-sa believes in working with what already exists on site in the most economical means, delivering enriched and renewed built-life to each project. The notion of renewal is researched and investigated within the practice and through teaching at t-sa forum, our own independently run research school. description: Threefold was founded in 2004 by friends; Matt Driscoll, Jack Hosea and Renée Searle with a shared mission to make buildings and spaces which do more; make us more Collaborative, Healthy, Inspired and Productive. This ethos influences every activity of our architectural practice and we seek to embed these values in how we work with our clients, our team, our partnerships and communities. Our award winning architecture practice has an established reputation for being at the forefront of both housing and mixed use design. Our focus is not the size of a project but its potential. Our schemes range from creating individual single family homes to unlocking the potential on small and complex sites to delivering large mixed use & residential developments of 150 units. We work with communities to understand their needs, designing appropriate typologies to accommodate families with integrated landscapes & play, compact units with generous shared amenity, specialist housing for supported living and co & multi-generational living. We work with leading housing providers including Pocket Living, BeFirst and Brick x Brick to design and deliver healthy mixed use developments. Our buildings are healthy on the inside and healthy for the outside world. We work with our clients to target net zero, designing the fabric of our buildings to work hard, minimising waste, re-using or selecting materials which are recycled or with low embodied energy, integrating biodiversity and harnessing technology to reduce carbon footprints and energy use. Everything we make has a positive impact. Address Studio 9, The Dove Centre, 109 Bartholemew Road, London, NW5 2BJ Contact Renée Searle Twitter @threefoldarch Instagram threefold_architects

Our expertise lies in these three key areas, and supported by a range of services, deliver a wide variety of projects for clients across the public, private and third sectors. Our work covers masterplanning and urban design strategies, town centre strategies and urban design frameworks. We work on small and medium site strategies, local authority policy and guidance documents, design codes, and large scale housing growth. We also provide urban design and design advice and support design review. Contact Hilary Satchwell Twitter @Tibbalds Instagram tibbalds

We also have to satisfy and reward ourselves. Control for us in design terms means precision and restraint, quality and authenticity – refined buildings without extravagant embellishment, rich in detail, material thought and precise execution. Liberated. Creativity and innovation tend to be associated with wild expression and deviation from the norm but the confidence we have in our abilities, our skill and our design intent free us from the need to follow fashion, ‘make a statement’ or deviate from what we feel is right. Our creativity and innovation is knitted in, not layered on. We’re proud of our work and it’s important we remain so. Address Eastgate, 2 Castle Street, Manchester, M3 4LZ Contact Tim Groom

Extensive research and development form the basis of all our work, continually adding to our expanding experience and allowing our inclusive design process to translate across a broad range of scales, sectors and typologies. name: Ullmayer Slyvester Architects
address: 2 Whatcott's Yard, Palatine Road, London, N16 8ST
description: Ullmayer Sylvester Architects are a design-led, award-winning architectural studio founded by Silvia Ullmayer and Allan Sylvester. We incorporated in 2005 following our participation in the collaborative custom-build housing project ‘In-Between’ in North London. Since then, we have created fine, handcrafted projects, which have been widely published. The stuff of life makes us hum. We embrace that we are all different: We are all bespoke. We come in different sizes. We have different families. We grow and we grow older. We like different things. So each of us has different expectations of what a home can be. Our studio has designed for many diverse individuals and households and have a wealth of experience in delivering homes for real people- beyond the traditional house and beyond standardised mass housing. Our research can be upscaled and incorporated in urban housing, giving clients more options and making richer, more sustainable homes and places. Not only do we engage in domestic architecture and housing but also work in urban and community contexts to make high quality, beautiful projects and environments. We never see spaces in isolation, but as part of a larger collection of rooms and spaces and set within a wider context. As a studio we question and re-invent typologies with enthusiasm and a sense of optimism. Together with our consultants and contractors we work through every step of the process to deliver cost-effective, distinct and elegant designs uniquely around our clients and their extended ‘families’. We are a women-led and British Caribbean practice and equal opportunity employer. We work closely with our consultants and with our contractors through every step of the design and construction process to deliver both cost effective and elegant designs. Our directors develop each project uniquely around our client and their family, they are at the heart of each project at all times. Address 2 Whatcott's Yard, Palatine Road, London, N16 8ST Contact Silvia Ullmayer Twitter @ullsylarc Instagram ullmayersylvester

We work in the best interest of our clients, collaborators and those that use our buildings, recognising that really successful architecture only happens when the right team comes together around a shared goal. Our approach is founded on respect, professionalism and creative vigour. We are based in Whitechapel, east London, and our work extends across the UK to settings both urban and rural. We commit to: 01. designing places where people feel they belong. 02. designing buildings that will last for a hundred years and beyond. name: Vppr Architects
description: Fresh thinkers. Fair practice. Female leadership. vPPR is a women-led architecture practice built on original and equitable design. From our studio in London we design for cultural, residential, office, public realm and education clients. The art of the new “We use artistic principles and artworks to create unexpected and thought-provoking design; to imagine something that nobody has experienced before. This also helps us make our designs inclusive and appealing to diverse audiences.” Jessica Reynolds, vPPR co-founder - creates a unique identity - instills a questioning approach - incorporates richness and layers of meaning - builds consensus through touchstone works - drives final design Architects of kindness vPPR was set up by Tatiana von Preussen, Catherine Pease and Jessica Reynolds in 2009. “vPPR is a women-led practice. From our founding we have built a culture of empathy and collaboration. We make sure all stakeholders – visitors, residents, staff, planners, artists and curators, young and old – feel free to speak their mind and voice their needs. This makes for happier clients and communities, and ultimately better designs.” Tatiana von Preussen, vPPR co-founder - empathetic and generous design - collaborative and inclusive - balances work and life - champions women in industry - puts people and planet first Making it sustainable “vPPR is responding to the climate emergency with creativity and ambition. Through carefully chosen sustainable materials and systems, we work with our clients to create net-zero whole life carbon buildings. We embrace the new aesthetic that comes with sustainability and adaptability and seek to push boundaries by exploring the use of emerging construction biomaterials such as mycelium.” Catherine Pease, vPPR co-founder - members of Architects Declare and RIBA 2030 Climate Challenge - work to LETI targets for operational energy use, water use and embodied carbon - ambitious BREEAM benchmarks fabric retention, upcycled and recycled materials as a priority - internally developed sustainability checklists - integrated biodiversity in every project Buildability, value and profit “From day one we focus on buildability and value for money. Every design decision we make has a value attached. If we spend on something to create a ‘wow’ factor we always justify it with a quantified benefit. Our designs must be desirable, striking and above all achievable within budget. ” Tatiana von Preussen, vPPR co-founder - robust, flexible and long-lasting design - tight cost control and quality assurance secures profit and stability - modern methods of construction minimise wastage - tried-and-tested materials and construction methods cut risk Addresses vPPR London 123 Camden High Street, NW1 7JR vPPR Liverpool 44 Canal Street, Liverpool, L20 8QU vPPR Hamburg vPPR Architektur GmbH, Große Elbstraße 279, Hamburg, 22767 Contact Tatiana von Preussen Twitter @vPPR_Architects Instagram vppr_architects

name: Wadhal
description: Wadhal is an architecture studio based in London, creating narrative-led spaces that reconsider design, tradition and culture. Founded by Fahad Malik, Wadhal delivers residential and commercial projects from concept through to built reality. Inspired by contradictions, the work of the practice is responsive. Each project takes on its own methodology, a story that reflects changes in context, climate, and character. Wadhal is a tribal name found in Mianwali, Namal Lake and the surrounding land in Pakistan. Its literal meaning translates to an increase, surplus or the notion of exceeding limitations. Addresses Unit 1, High Street House, 83 Askew Road, London, W12 9AH Soho Works, 2 Television Centre, 101 Wood Lane, London, W12 7FR Contact Fahad Malik Instagram studiowadhal

description: Walters & Cohen’s design approach is thorough, demanding and rational. Our work is underpinned by a passionate belief in the importance of design excellence and detailed research into appropriate and innovative building materials and technologies. We design bold, contemporary, imaginative buildings that are fit for purpose, accessible and loved by the people who use them. Our approach also involves a lot of collaboration, which we believe is fundamental to successful projects. It means having open, honest and productive dialogue with our clients, design team and others who have a stake in the project. It means guiding people through the design process from the start to the end – even those who thought they had little to contribute – so that they can make informed decisions and we can approach challenges together. We ask the right questions and we listen to the answers, translating them into ideas that can be developed through conversation. We love working with people who share this collaborative ethos: one client said our consultation was conducted ‘to a high level of professionalism, with little fuss, and a sense of humour. An architectural practice with flair and expertise, and without ego.’ Address 2 Wilkin Street, London, NW5 2NL Contact Michal Cohen Instagram waltersandcohen

name: Weston Williamson And Partners Llp
description: We are a design-led practice, with talented designers and a strong record of delivery. We take a whole life approach, considering how our designs will adapt, retain their relevance and continue to be enjoyed for years to come. We aim to see our projects through to completion; making them helps us to design better places. The way buildings and spaces are put together, how things connect, support, touch and enclose informs all our work. We value simplicity and elegance; what is essential to ensure the intelligent use of the world’s resources. Addresses 12 Valentine Place, London, SE1 8QH One St Peter's Square, Manchester, M2 3DE Contact Christopher Williamson Twitter @WW_Architecture Instagram westonwilliamson

name: What If Projects
description: what if: projects is an award-winning architecture practice, and we have a track record of providing high-quality architectural services tailored to the requirements of public and third-sector clients. We work collaboratively and flexibly with often complex stakeholder and client groups to accommodate project-specific processes and timelines. Our small team brings creativity and extensive experience to project development. We pay attention to detail and are committed to delivering all our work to a high standard. Our selection to the Mayor of London’s A+U Framework (2023) to support High Street & Town Centre Recovery has recognised the quality of our practice. We seek to work with clients who want to explore creative approaches in response to the biodiversity and climate crisis. Below an overview of our interests and the fields of work we engage with: HOUSING ENVIRONMENTS: We work in the social housing context to adapt existing buildings, transform shared open spaces, and create the social infrastructure that complements housing. Our participatory process is guided by a commitment to sustainability and resilience. BUILDING DESIGN: Embracing a non-fussy, simple, and restrained design language, we have refurbished, reconfigured, and expanded existing structures to accommodate changing needs and designed proposals for zero-carbon public buildings. ACTIVE TRAVEL: We design urban environments around active, human-powered transport to reduce air pollution and enhance living conditions. Collaborating with stakeholders such as local governments, policymakers, campaign groups, highway engineers, schools, and citizens, we develop strategies and deliver projects prioritising cycling and walking. PUBLIC SPACE: Our public realm work focuses on ordinary streets and neglected open spaces. We collaborate with neighbourhoods and borough councils to create urban environments that improve the quality of life for people and nature. Greening is a key objective – from tree planting to sustainable urban drainage solutions. URBAN RESILIENCE: Our projects leverage local knowledge and community participation to create more equitable, climate-resilient urban environments. We support grassroots organisations in their efforts to effect change locally. Small projects can bring powerful, positive outcomes for people and places. ARTISTIC PRACTICE: Our work is grounded in artistic practice and evolved through art commissions and collaborations. These initiatives are calls for action, provocations and critiques of given conditions. They are a testbed for ideas and, at times, the beginning of something new. Address what if: shop 39 Cropley Street, London, UK, N1 7HT Contact Ulrike Steven Instagram what_if_projects

name: Whitaker Studio
address: 49 Granville Road, London, E17 9BS
description: Based out of our office in London, Whitaker Studio designs one of a kind buildings, master plans and objects for clients who want something unique. We are passionate about what we do and strive to create the best. We don't have a set style, or set way of working, but rather a constantly evolving collection of interests we want to explore. We start every project with no preconception of what it should be other than that it should be the best possible project it can be. Address 49 Granville Road, London, E17 9BS Contact James Whitaker

name: White Arkitekter
address: 77 Bastwick Street, London, EC1V 3PZ
description: We work with sustainable architecture, urban design, landscape architecture and interior design for current and future generations. Our mission is to enable sustainable life through the art of architecture. Our vision is that by 2030 all our architecture will be climate neutral, through design excellence. Responsibility, curiosity, involvement and respect are core values that imbue everything we do. Our values remain the constant in a world of change. We work with sustainable architecture, design and urban development in an international context. We need to act responsibly as our work affects the lives of many both present and future generations. We create spaces for people to thrive and grow in harmony with the ecosystem that we inhabit. We act responsibly by operating within the sustainable limits of our planet when we design healthy living environments that inspire and engage. Our curiosity is reflected in the way we work. We believe that search for new knowledge will strengthen our offer for the future. Therefore, we continuously invest in research and development. Through design, creativity and a humanistic approach, we look to solve great challenges. We believe that architecture is shaped by the unique qualities of its context. This makes us radical contextualists. Our 700+ employees are continually developing their knowledge base and generating innovative typologies and tools, and White Research Lab and our R&D foundation both support research projects geared towards creating maximum value in projects. We have design skills to tackle major regeneration schemes in the rapid transition from an industrial to a technological age. Key projects reflecting the scale of that transition and our experience include the making of Hammarby Sjöstad in central Stockholm – the city’s first ‘environmentally profiled’ regeneration projects. Hammarby, in which White played a prominent role, is one of Europe’s most highly regarded urban regeneration projects. Our recent Completion of 1200 homes on the Gascoigne Estate in Barking, is an example of delivering a high density landscape led masterplan. Our masterplans for Charlton Riverside, Barking Riverside and more recently Malmo Quays on the River Tyne in Newcastle shows how we work with the Scandinavian background and experience, translating this into the context in the UK and abroad. Address 77 Bastwick Street, London, EC1V 3PZ Contact Linda Thiel Twitter @whitearkitekter Instagram whitearkitekter

We work most frequently in the leisure and residential sectors, and on ‘green’ building projects, including autonomous Earthship dwellings and alternative construction methods such as straw bale. name: Whittaker Parsons Ltd
description: We are Whittaker Parsons, award-winning architects who build less and design better. We make our buildings well, with worth and foresight. Based in east London, we help homeowners, likeminded developers, cultural and commercial organisations to solve space problems and build with balance. Our work ranges from pavilions to private homes, community centres to concept stores, all of them the product of a principled, resourceful approach. We make well. We find healthy and progressive materials, optimise the way they are put together and build with great technique to make buildings loved by their users and communities. We find worth. Our experience shows us that the best buildings unfold from a bespoke and enjoyably energetic design process where every person’s views are valued, all opportunities are uncovered, and we get the very best out of the resources we use. We see further. We build the kind of architecture we’d like others to build too: future-facing projects where the architects are more broadly accountable for their actions, and lean, pragmatic, beautiful buildings that last longer, use less – and feel just right. Address Whittaker Parsons St.Hilda's, 18 Club Row, London,, E2 7EY Contact Matthew Whittaker Instagram whittakerparsons

name: Witherford Watson Mann Architects
address: 1 Coate Street, London, E2 9AG
description: We started off our collaboration, nearly twenty years ago, with a series of walks through the edges of London; since then, we have approached every project as an open-ended enquiry. We develop our designs in conversation with our clients, helping progressive institutions do more of what they're good at. We expand, reinforce and complement the characteristics of existing spaces with focused and crafted additions. Whether adapting an old furniture factory for Amnesty or shaping the city plan for London’s Olympic quarter, we have always made the most of what is already there, adding judiciously to maintain the distinctiveness of each place but transform its capacity. We are now a small, skilled studio of seventeen, with Stephen, Chris and William still closely involved in the design and delivery of all projects. Address 1 Coate Street, London, E2 9AG Contact Stephen Witherford Instagram wwmarchitects

address: 101-103 Heath Street, London, NW3 6SS
description: We consider the role of architecture and design in the context of broader societal issues to address problems and find opportunities to create projects that can deliver a significant impact. name: Yn Studio
description: [Y/N] Studio is a creative platform established to ask questions of the built environment The complexity associated with designing and constructing our cities is astounding and a great deal of architecture serves only to add complexity. We think the role of the designer is to question these established but convoluted processes and reduce complexity. We work with the various inputs, histories, technologies and constraints with which we are presented to formulate a response rather than imposing an abstract theology, manifesto or style. We, as architects, are editors of the process. The questions, and the problems, can be incredibly complex, but a successful answer should be as simple as Yes or No. While disparate in nature, scale, form and material, our projects are all characterised by a combination of pragmatic problem solving and idealistic ingenuity. We call this approach Pragmatic Idealism. Address Unit 301, Bradbury Works 3 Bradbury Street, N16 8JN Contact Alex Smith Twitter @YesNoStudio Instagram ynstudioarchitects

We believe even the smallest interventions can have a big impact and community participation throughout the process is key to our approach. For us it is all about our collaborative approach, the process, the way we work with each other and everyone involved in any one project. description: ZEDfactory began as Bill Dunster Architects in 1999. From day one, the company has been exclusively committed to low carbon building and development. Using tried and tested technologies, ZEDfactory creates designs that are stimulating and practical on a daily basis, yet distinctive, economic and reliable in the long term. Today, ZEDfactory is a leader in the field of zero-carbon design and development, with a unique track record of delivering Zero (fossil) Energy Development (ZED) buildings in the UK and worldwide. The company offers the full range of architectural services, from master-planning and design of large-scale ‘Eco-villages’ to one-off individual building commissions. The ZEDfactory also works closely with leading UK academics and consultants to model predicted energy consumption and production, fluid dynamics and whole life cycle carbon costs of their designs to ensure they achieve the lowest environmental impact possible. The ZED Factory is a leading light in low-carbon living. We have extensive experience in the design and realisation of energy efficient buildings of all types and sizes. The company’s designs for zero carbon building projects are sought out by clients around the world. Address 5 Bluebird Cl, Raynes Park, London, SW20 0AT Contact Bill Dunster Twitter @zedfactory Instagram zedfactory

Their passion, expertise and creative prowess unite a global team of >360 people and 35 nationalities. In-house specialist teams ensure seamless design integration to include engineering, graphics, lighting, irrigation, horticulture, BIM, QS services and post-contract management. name: Sanchez Benton 2
address: 111 St John Street, London, EC1V 4JA
description: With every project, the team sets out to understand the cultural setting of the work and then develops an appropriate response. It is a method that celebrates and respects the latent beauty and merit in what is present, what has been, and what could come next. They enjoy the practical and poetic potential in the way buildings are made and engage fully in each step towards the realisation of the designs. The practice looks at architecture as a frame for life at all its levels; they believe it should act wisely and with humour and kindness. Address 111 St John Street, London, EC1V 4JA Contact Carlos Sanchez Instagram sanchez_benton

address: United House, 39-41 North Road, London, N7 9DP

We love working on education projects that will bring a real change in the student and teacher’s school lives, on community projects that will enhance the quality of life and will make a difference in people’s everyday lives. Address First Floor, Front Building, 148-150 Curtain Road, London, EC2A 3AT Contact Tom Smith Instagram spacehubdesign

description: Since Stride Treglown was founded in 1953, we’ve been clear that great design requires a human approach, deep local knowledge, and specialist expertise. All backed by verified results. Address 3 Cosser Street, London, SE1 7BU Contact Raymond Williamson Instagram stridetreglown

name: Studio Egret West 2
address: 3 Brewhouse Yard, London, EC1V 4JQ

name: Studio Gb
address: 4 Elm Grove, London, SE15 5DB
description: Studio gb is a landscape architecture and design studio focused on the integration of nature into the city. We are committed to improving the quality of urban life by introducing a specifically ecological aesthetic into our cityscapes. Our work is predicated upon craft, observation, research, engagement and environmentally sustainable solutions to establish unique areas of serenity, resilience and solidarity in an accelerating world. Address 4 Elm Grove, London, SE15 5DB Contact Vladimir Guculak Instagram studiogb.uk

name: Studio Onb
address: Second Floor, 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE
description: Welcome to Studio ONB, a design-led landscape studio established to explore the role of the urban realm and landscape in addressing the complex environmental, ecological, and societal challenges of our time. The Human. We are interested in the everyday lived experience of landscapes. We work collaboratively with communities to understand the life that underpins a place, exploring the connections and barriers to engaging with space, and finding ways to reconnect people who feel disconnected from – or alienated by – their contexts. The Natural. We are interested in nature in all its venerated and unruly forms, embracing its existence and persistence within the structure of the city. Through our work, we explore the power of natural landscapes on the human psyche, their dialogue with the built environment, and the potential of urban ecologies to support both nature and daily wellbeing. Address Second Floor, 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE Contact Ben Smith Instagram studio_onb

name: Studio Weave 2
address: 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE
description: Studio Weave is an architectural practice based in London, UK. We build new connections between materials, history and culture. The practice has developed an international reputation for delivering a wide range of extraordinary projects in cultural, educational, heritage, arts, public realm and residential sectors. Address 217 Mare Street, London, E8 3QE Contact Je Ahn Instagram studioweave

name: Tapestry
description: Our belief is that our world should be a tapestry of natural and built environments working in harmony together, and providing spaces where both people and nature can thrive. Our website seeks to provide an overview of who we are, what we do, and most importantly what we believe in and allows us to present you with an introduction to our practice and people. Address Tapestry HQ Mainyard Studios, 90 Wallis Road, London, E9 5LN Contact Paul Reynolds Instagram _TapestryStudio

name: Todd Longstaffe Gowan
address: 17 Rosebery Avenue, London, EC1R 4SP
description: Todd Longstaffe-Gowan takes on a range of diverse projects both in Britain and abroad. Many of them have included an element of conservation; Todd brings to his garden design a sense of the complexities of our relation to the past that is informed by his training and experience as an architect, landscape architect, cultural geographer and historian. He has a strong interest in the sculptural and dramatic potential of landscapes, and in the ways in which their aesthetic possibilities relate to the uses, activities and symbolic functions for which they are destined. Address 17 Rosebery Avenue, London, EC1R 4SP Contact None Instagram too_longstaff_gowan

name: Tonkin Liu 2
address: 5 Wilmington Square, London, WC1X 0ES
description: Founded in 2002 by Mike Tonkin and Anna Liu on a storytelling methodology and passion for technical innovation. We answer the unique needs of our aspirational clients through an emphatic search for optimal design solutions. A UK multi-disciplinary design studio, we have been delivering award-winning architecture, sculpture, and landscape, winning 23 RIBA Awards in 22 years. Our work has been described as both puritanical and fantastical. We put emphasis on place-making, connecting people to nature, and pioneering innovative construction techniques. Address 5 Wilmington Square, London, WC1X 0ES Contact Michael Tonkin Instagram tonkinliu

name: Tor And Co

We pride ourselves on building long-term relationships, so that together with clients, communities, and partners, we realise our mission to build a lasting legacy. Address 23 Heddon Street, London, W1B 4BQ Contact Richard Burton Instagram None

Address Northumberland House, 303-306 High Holborn, London, WC1V 7JZ Contact Robert Townshend Instagram tonwshend_landscape_architects

name: Vogt

Working with water is an important part of our work, as is an understanding of culture, history, context and place. Address Level 7, Elizabeth House, 39 York Road, London, SE1 7NQ Contact Peter Wilder Instagram wilder_landscapes

name: Witherford Watson Mann Architects 2

We develop our designs in conversation with our clients, helping progressive institutions do more of what they're good at. Address 1 Coate Street, London, E2 9AG Contact Stephen Witherford Instagram wwmarchitects
